title: Voting guide: Here’s what voters need to know before Boston’s Tuesday election
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Voting in Boston's municipal election occurs from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. across 275 precincts.
Mayor Michelle Wu is unopposed, but Boston City Council races feature contested at-large and district seats.
Mail-in ballots must be returned by 8 p.m. Tuesday, not at polling places, but via drop boxes or City Hall.

title: The Bruins’ second line is looking like a difference-maker, in more ways than one
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Bruins' second line with Pavel Zacha, Casey Mittelstadt, and Viktor Arvidsson led offensively in a 2-1 win over the Hurricanes.
Casey Mittelstadt's return has boosted the second line, helping outscore opponents 4-2 over 66 minutes in recent games.
Coach Marco Sturm's benching strategy has revitalized performance, exemplified by Mittelstadt's resurgence and Marat Khusnutdinov's contributions.

title: Garrett Crochet, Roman Anthony named finalist for Cy Young, Rookie of the Year Awards
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Garrett Crochet is a finalist for the AL Cy Young Award after leading the AL with 205.1 innings pitched and 255 strikeouts.
Crochet, in his first season with the Red Sox, had an 18-5 record and 2.59 ERA, excelling in the postseason.
Roman Anthony is a finalist for AL Rookie of the Year, achieving a .292 batting average and 32 RBIs in 71 games.

title: Ranking top priorities for Patriots at NFL trade deadline
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots prioritize acquiring an edge rusher at the NFL trade deadline to bolster their defensive pass-rushing corps.
Team seeks depth at running back due to injuries, considering options like Cleveland's Jerome Ford for the ground game.
New England evaluates trade options at linebacker, safety, cornerback, and wide receiver to address roster deficiencies.

title: Patriots’ pass-protection issues are mounting as Drake Maye ties worrisome stat from last year
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Patriots' offensive line struggles, allowing 34 sacks this season, second highest in the NFL.
Drake Maye tied last season's sack total despite playing four fewer games, highlighting protection issues.
Center Garrett Bradbury suggests avoiding obvious passing situations to reduce pressure on the quarterback.

title: Downtown Boston hotel settles discrimination complaint after woman was accused of being a man
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Liberty Hotel settled a discrimination complaint after Ansley Baker was wrongly accused of being a man.
The settlement requires the hotel to donate $10,000 and update its nondiscrimination policies and training.
Baker plans to file a civil lawsuit for punitive damages, claiming the hotel misrepresented the incident.

title: Falcons coach walks back ‘clapgate’ accusations after Patriots push back
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Falcons coach Raheem Morris retracted accusations of the Patriots mimicking snap counts after a close 24-23 loss.
The alleged incident involved Atlanta's QB Michael Penix Jr. mistaking claps for the snap count, resulting in a penalty.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel dismissed the claims, suggesting the noise was from fans rather than intentional clap mimicry.

title: Alex Bregman opts out of Red Sox contract, will hit free agency
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Bregman has opted out of his Red Sox contract, becoming a free agent this offseason.
Bregman had two years and $80 million remaining on his contract with opt-out clauses after 2025 and 2026.
The Red Sox will attempt to retain Bregman, but teams like the Tigers and Mariners are interested.

title: Patriots NFL trade deadline live updates: Will New England make moves before Tuesday?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots, at 7-2, are considering upgrades before the NFL trade deadline on Tuesday at 4 p.m.
Coach Mike Vrabel stated the team's record won't force trade decisions but remains open to beneficial deals.
New England is exploring trade options, including OLB Anfernee Jennings, while considering potential acquisitions.

title: After an eventful week, Bruins’ Hampus Lindholm has ‘a lot to be thankful for’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hampus Lindholm returned to the Bruins' lineup after a lower-body injury, significantly improving the team's defense.
Lindholm and his fiancée Amanda welcomed their first child, Magnolia, celebrating their personal milestone.
The Bruins are 5-1-0 with Lindholm playing, highlighting his critical role in the team's recent successes.
